content.heading: Gift a Workpal to a colleague
content.subheading: Know someone drowning in email? Set up their AI colleague in 10 seconds.
content.body: One click. They get an email with their new Workpal address. No signup, no app, no prompts. Just forward and go. You'll both save hours.
content.visual: Mock email showing the gift notification: 'Lorraine set up an AI colleague for you. Your Workpal address is sarah.j@workpal.email. Forward any email to it.'

sections.why: This is the #1 viral mechanic. It needs prominent placement on the landing page. The gift framing is emotionally stronger than 'invite.' You're giving someone a tool, not asking them to sign up for something.

sections.current: 5 questions: Will it email clients? | Need prompts? | Writing style? | Data secure? | Misunderstands task?

changes.what: Keep all 5 existing FAQs — they're solid
Add FAQ: 'How much does it cost?'
changes.answer: Workpal is free for up to 10 forwards per month. Pro is $12/month for unlimited forwards with style learning and contact memory.

changes.what: Add FAQ: 'I manage multiple executives. Can Workpal match different writing styles?'
changes.answer: Yes. Workpal learns each voice separately. When you forward a thread from Exec A, it drafts in Exec A's tone. Forward from Exec B, it shifts to match. The more you use it per exec, the sharper it gets.

changes.what: Add FAQ: 'Can I gift a Workpal to someone?'
changes.answer: Yes. One click and they'll receive an email with their own Workpal address. No signup required. They just start forwarding.

changes.what: Modify FAQ: 'How does it know my writing style?'

changes.to: Workpal learns automatically from every email you forward and every edit you make to its drafts. Within a week, it picks up your jargon and formality level. Within a month, most users send drafts with zero edits. You can accelerate this by connecting your LinkedIn or describing your role.
